articles.title: Kim Jong Il Receives Figures Related to N.-S. Summit and widow of Rev. Mun Ik Hwan
Grand Festival for National Reunification Closes
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Receives Figures Related to N.-S. Summit and widow of Rev. Mun Ik Hwan 
    Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il Friday received Rim Tong Won, former director of the National Intelligence Service, Pak Jae Gyu, former minister of Unification, Choe Hak Rae, former manager of the newspaper Hangyore, Kim Po Hyon, former vice-director of the National Intelligence Service, Kang Man Gil, former president of Sangji University, and Kim Min Ha, former chief vice-chairman of the Advisory Council on Peaceful Unification Policy, who are related to the historic north-south summit, and Pak Yong Gil, widow of Rev. Mun Ik Hwan.
 On hand was Rim Tong Ok, first vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
 Kim Jong Il had a warm conversation with them, looking back upon the historic days five years ago when the landmark for reunification common to the nation was provided.
 On the same day he hosted a luncheon for the special envoy of President Roh Moo Hyun and his party, those related to the summit and the widow of Rev. Mun Ik Hwan.
 The luncheon proceeded in an amicable atmosphere overflowing with compatriotic feelings.

articles.content:
Reception Given by British Ambassador 
    Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- A reception was given by David Arthur Slinn, British ambassador to the DPRK, Thursday evening on the occasion of its
queen's official birthday, the national day of Britain.
 Present on invitation were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Kim Yong Jae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Choe Chang Il, vice-minister of Culture, Hong Son Ok, vice-chairwoman of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international organizations here.    
 Speeches were made there.

articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of Authorities of South Side
    Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met at the Mokran House Thursday the delegation of the authorities of the south side led by Minister of Unification Jong Tong Yong which participated in the grand festival for national reunification marking the fifth anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration.
 Present there were Kim Ki Nam, vice-chairman of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland, Kwon Ho Ung, head of the north side to the north-south ministerial talks, Kim Yong Sam, minister of Railways, Kim Yong Jin, minister of Education, Kim Su Hak, minister of Public Health, and officials concerned.
 The conversation proceeded in a fraternal atmosphere.

articles.content:
U.S. Enactment of "North Korean Human Rights Act" Assailed
    Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- The Council of Christian Churches of south Korea issued a statement on June 14 in which it denounced the United States
for enacting the "North Korean Human Rights Act", according to the south Korean CBS.
 The statement criticized the enactment of the act as interference in the internal affairs of the north aimed at the change of its system. The U.S. uses non-human right value for its political hegemony, it said.
 Saying that the enactment of the act might spell a serous crisis to inter-Korean reconciliation and cooperation, the statement urged the U.S. to regard peace on the Korean Peninsula as the foremost value.

articles.content:
Delegation of S. Korean Authorities Leaves
    Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- The delegation of authorities of the south side led by Jong Tong Yong, minister of Unification, who participated in the grand festival for national reunification to mark the fifth anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration left here today.
 It was seen off at the airport by the Kwon Ho Ung, head of the north side's delegation to the inter-Korean ministerial talks, Ri Jong Hyok, vice-chairman of the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee, Choe Yong Gon, north side's chairman of the Committee for the Promotion of the North-South Economic Cooperation, and officials concerned.
